results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Classified Information and State Secrets;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);National Archives and Records Administration
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Glenn Thrush
results.title: Trump Lawyer Told Justice Dept. That Classified Material Had Been Returned
results.abstract: The lawyer signed a statement in June that all documents marked as classified and held in boxes in storage at Mar-a-Lago had been given back. The search at the former president’s home on Monday turned up more.

media.caption: An inventory of the material taken from Mar-a-Lago on Monday showed that F.B.I. agents seized 11 sets of documents with some type of confidential or secret marking on them.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Archives and Records;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Garland, Merrick B;Justice Department;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);National Archives and Records Administration
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush and Charlie Savage
results.title: Files Seized From Trump Are Part of Espionage Act Inquiry
results.abstract: The materials included some marked as top secret and meant to be viewed only in secure government facilities, according to a copy of the warrant.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s legal team has until 3 p.m. Eastern on Friday to officially respond.
media.copyright: Brittainy Newman for The New York Times

results.title: Rushdie Stabbed Roughly 10 Times in Premeditated Attack, Prosecutors Say
results.abstract: The writer, who was gravely wounded and had been put on a ventilator after surgery, is now talking in the hospital, according to his agent.

media.caption: Hadi Matar, 24, center, made an appearance at the Chautauqua County Courthouse in Mayville, N.Y., for his arraignment on charges of second-degree attempted murder and assault with a weapon.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: Paranoia and Pastels at Bama Rush
results.abstract: Fears about TikTok and rumors of a secret documentary swirl around sorority rush week at the University of Alabama.

media.caption: After the sorority rush at the University of Alabama went viral on TikTok last year, the week has taken on new tension.
media.copyright: Jill Frank for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Classified Information and State Secrets;Law and Legislation;Search and Seizure;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Republican Party;House of Representatives;House Committee on Intelligence
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Michael C. Bender
results.title: As Search Shows Trump Had Secret Files, G.O.P. Splits Over Assailing F.B.I.
results.abstract: House Republicans on the Intelligence Committee expressed support for law enforcement. As for lawmakers saying otherwise? “Question them, not us.”

media.caption: Republican members of the House Intelligence Committee discussed the F.B.I. search of former President Donald J. Trump’s home. From left, Brian Fitzpatrick of Pennsylvania, Chris Stewart of Utah, Markwayne Mullin of Oklahoma, Elise Stefanik of New York and Brad Wenstrup of Ohio.
media.copyright: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times

results.title: Defamation Suit About Election Falsehoods Puts Fox on Its Heels
results.abstract: The suit, filed by Dominion Voting Systems, could be one of the most consequential First Amendment cases in a generation.

media.caption: The Fox News studio in Manhattan on election night in 2020. A defamation suit by Dominion Voting Systems threatens a huge financial and reputational blow to Fox.

results.title: Anne Heche Is Brain-Dead After Crash, Representative Says
results.abstract: The actress, 53, was being kept on life support while it was being determined if her organs could be donated, the representative said.

media.caption: Anne Heche starred in several popular Hollywood films in the late 1990s, including “Donnie Brasco,” “Wag the Dog” and “Six Days Seven Nights.”

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Masks;Quarantines;Education (K-12);your-feed-health;your-feed-science;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;United States
results.title: C.D.C. Eases Covid Guidelines, Noting Virus Is ‘Here to Stay’
results.abstract: The new guidelines eliminate quarantines and put less emphasis on social distancing, routine surveillance testing and contact tracing.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: People who are exposed to the virus no longer need to quarantine at home, regardless of their vaccination status, according to the new guidelines, but they should wear a mask for 10 days and get tested for the virus on Day 5.

results.adx_keywords: Part-Time Employment;Travel and Vacations;Labor and Jobs;Employee Fringe Benefits;Hotels and Travel Lodgings;United Airlines;Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc
results.title: Silver-Haired and Shameless About Perks: Retirees Take Part-Time Work in the Travel Industry
results.abstract: Spend 15 hours a week loading baggage at the airport or passing out towels at the pool, and you can see Europe for a fraction of the usual cost.

media.caption: Joey Boyd-Scott, left, and her wife, Maria, both have part-time travel jobs. The ongoing labor shortage is pushing the sector to consider senior citizens for positions that are far from senior.
media.copyright: Beth Coller for The New York Times

results.title: Southern Baptist Convention Says It Faces Federal Investigation for Sexual Abuse
results.abstract: Church leaders disclosed that multiple Southern Baptist entities were under investigation and said that all would cooperate.

media.caption: The leadership of the Southern Baptist Convention said on Friday that the church was under investigation by the Justice Department for sexual abuse.

results.byline: By Joseph Goldstein and Sharon Otterman
results.title: Polio Has Been Detected in New York City Wastewater, Officials Say
results.abstract: The detection of the virus in sewage suggests it is circulating in the city, Health Department officials said.

media.caption: A pop-up vaccination clinic was opened in Rockland County, N.Y., where a polio case was detected earlier this summer. Health authorities have urged people who are not vaccinated against polio to get immunized.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.title: Anne Heche Onscreen: Wily and Funny but Also Unnerving
results.abstract: Hollywood tried to slot her into cookie-cutter blockbusters, sometimes successfully. She was at her best playing competent women in extreme situations.

results.title: What to Know as the Pause on Student Loans Is Set to Expire
results.abstract: There are signs that the pause on payments and interest on most federal student loans will be extended past the end of this month. But the details on loan forgiveness remain unclear.
